description: From Spanish alcarraza, from Arabic الكُرَّاز‎ (al-kurrāz), from Aramaic כרז / כרוז‎ (“a type of container”), possibly from Akkadian 𒆳𒍣𒍝𒆪 (/kurziza, kurzizakku/, “a basket, container”), from Sumerian 𒄥𒋛𒁲 (/gursisa/, “basket, container”, literally “normal or standard 𒄥 (gur)”).

entries.meaning: a jug, pitcher, etc. made of porous earthenware.
